row.header: What did you do this past week?
row.text: This past week, I spent a lot of time studying for my Data Mining class and writing essay for my literature class. I think I did fairly well on the Data Mining. Other than that, I spent some time working problems on LeetCode to prepare myself for future technical interviews. I realize that your technical background for an entry-level position isn't always required to be fantastic. They know you won't have Senior level experience coming out of college. So, it all falls down to the interview a lot of time.
I have data mining exam on Tuesday. Then, I have my sprint review at work. For this sprint review, I will need to show the progress I've made on my new and last project at MaxPoint.

row.header: What will you do next week?
row.text: This coming week, I will be working on SWE a lot. I will have to find a way to automatically deploy our dev version of the website to compute engine instead of Flexible App Engine. Flexible App Engine is just way too expensive to run our frontend. At the minimalist configuration, it still costs us about $1.50 a day. Yes, the educational fund will last us through the semester, but I would like to keep the site up and running for as long as possible.

row.header: What's my experience of the class?
row.text: The Regex lecture was very refreshing. I have been using regex a lot to convert repetitive Java code into Scala. I didn't realize that a lot of people in class do not have the same kind of Regex experience, so the lecture definitely was useful in introducing regex to everyone who hasn't worked with it.

My pick-of-the-week is this video below. I've been around a lot of cats recently, and I have never seen a cat who never jump to their food when given. It's just nice to sympathize with this mother cat. Watch here!
